meanings.definition: Make (a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling) worse.
meanings.sent1: His constant complaints only ended up exacerbating the situation.
meanings.sent2: Yelling at each other will only exacerbate the argument.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the leaky faucet with a hammer ended up exacerbating the problem.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs will exacerbate the inevitable consequences.
meanings.sent5: The lack of communication between the team members was exacerbating the tension in the office.

meanings.definition: Aggravate or irritate (a person or situation).
meanings.sent1: Her loud chewing noises were exacerbating everyone in the quiet library.
meanings.sent2: The constant honking of car horns only serves to exacerbate road rage.
meanings.sent3: The cat's persistent meowing was exacerbating the grumpy neighbor next door.
meanings.sent4: The buzzing mosquito exacerbated my already irritated skin.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive beeping sound was exacerbating my headache.
